intro: Potentilla taurica f. dobrogensis, commonly known as the Dobrogian potentilla, is a rare and endemic plant found in specific regions of Eastern Europe. It belongs to the Rosaceae family and is characterized by its compact growth habit and small, yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils, preferring sunny to partially shaded environments. Its leaves are usually narrow and have a slightly hairy texture, while its stems are often reddish in color. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a botanically significant species with potential ecological and horticultural value.
